div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1763 Tell Halaf, on the Turko-Syrian (1086) border just S of Res el-ain (anc. Re- saina, Mesopotamia), 1913 Burial: c. 235 B.C. (M Contents: 352 AR Alexander III: 49 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 13, Lampsacus 1, Sardes 1, Side 1, Salamis? 1, An- tigoncia 1, Tyre 1, Ace 1, Babylon 5, barb. imit. 1, unc. 23) 210 dr. (Lampsacus 20, Abydus 9, Colophon 48, Magnesia 3, Miletus 14, Sardes 7, Aradus 1, Tyre 1, unc. 1107) 4 late post. tetradr. (Te- nedos 1, Miletus 1, unc. 2) 2 dr. (Chios) Philip III: 3 tetradr. (Aradus 2, Baby- lon 1) 8 dr. (Lampsacus 1, Colophon 5, Magnesia 1, Sardes? 1) Demetrius Poliorcetes: 3 tetradr. (Amphi- polis 1, unc. 2) Lysimachus: 26 lifetime or post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 1, Lysimacheia 1, Hera- cleia Bith. 2, Lampsacus 7, Colophon 1, unc. 14) 4 dr. (Colophon 2, Ephesus 1, unc. 1) Attalus I: 4 tetradr. Unc. Attalid: 1 tetradr. Seleucus I: 5 tetradr. (Ecbatana 3, Laodi- ceia ad Mare 1 as WSM 1210, Tarsus 1) Antiochus I: 8 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim 4, Ecbatana 2, Sardes 1, unc. 1) Antiochus II: 25 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 4, Antiocheia 5, Apameia 14, Tarsus 1, Lysimacheia? 1) Disposition: Istanbul Regling, ZfN 1928, p. 95 Newell, ESM and WSM, indices of hoards, s. v. Tell Halaf The coins of Antiochus III mentioned by Regling all belong to Antiochus II. The latest coins in the hd. are the Pergamene issues of Attalus I
